    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/there-peanut-farmer-plains-field-2020-democrats-n848986?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Is there a peanut farmer from Plains in the field of 2020 Dems?</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 13:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/there-peanut-farmer-plains-field-2020-democrats-n848986?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Steve Kornacki</dc:creator>
      <description>The signs are everywhere that the 2020 Democratic presidential field will be much larger than usual — maybe larger than ever.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2017_11/1933456/170315-jimmy-carter-in-1976-0503_b0c05f5134a96cba2d14526a04475702.jpg" medium="image" height="3003" width="2056">
        <media:credit>AP Photo, file</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Jimmy Carter in 1976<media:description type="plain">President-elect Jimmy Carter and wife Rosalynn at a victory party in Atlanta, Ga., on Nov. 3, 1976. Carter won the presidential election by 297 electoral votes to 241 for Gerald Ford. </media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_44/739606/141028-carter-gov-clinton-jms-2154_7e0452761f05df2993a9c12b85546f42.jpg" medium="image" height="1697" width="2500">
        <media:credit>John Duricka</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: President Jimmy Carter, left, and Gov. Bill Clinton<media:description type="plain">Then-President Jimmy Carter, left, and then-Arkansas Gov. Bill Clinton enjoy a chuckle during a rally for Carter, Wednesday, Oct. 22, 1980, Texarkana, Texas.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/rally-parkland-shooting-survivors-rail-against-gun-laws-nra-trump-n849076?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Parkland shooting survivors rail against gun laws, NRA and Trump</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:58:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/rally-parkland-shooting-survivors-rail-against-gun-laws-nra-trump-n849076?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Chelsea Bailey</dc:creator>
      <description>"If all our government and president can do is send 'thoughts and prayers,' then it's time for victims to be the change," said one student.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332666/180217-emma-gonzales-firearms-safety-legislation-protest-ew-323p_ae7f1d95e974132c752337cc7b3464fa.jpg" medium="image" height="1080" width="1920">
        <media:credit>NBC News</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Emma Gonzales speaks at the rally against gun violence in Florida on Feb. 17, 2018.<media:description type="plain">Emma Gonzalez speaks at a rally for gun control at the Broward County Federal Courthouse in Fort Lauderdale, Florida on Feb. 17, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332676/180217-child-poster-firearms-safety-legislation-protest-ew-323p_d1bb0e7ce7e028288e16024b27b9d9d9.jpg" medium="image" height="1080" width="1920">
        <media:credit>NBC News</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A child holds a poster at a rally for gun control at the Broward County Federal Courthouse in Fort Lauderdale, Florida on Feb. 17, 2018.<media:description type="plain">A child holds a poster at a rally for gun control at the Broward County Federal Courthouse in Fort Lauderdale, Florida on Feb. 17, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mideast/russian-hand-seen-behind-increased-bombing-syrian-hospitals-n847961?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Russian hand seen behind increased bombing of Syrian hospitals</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:55:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mideast/russian-hand-seen-behind-increased-bombing-syrian-hospitals-n847961?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ziad Jaber and F. Brinley Bruton  and Elena Holodny and Alice Tidey and Reuters and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>Doctors with the Syrian American Medical Society report a sharp rise in the number of hospital attacks since the start of the year.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328516/180214-syria-ghouta-airstrike-injured-njs-1002a_5ff35788ff126e623f1f7d4cfaab3ee0.jpg" medium="image" height="1697" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Amer Almohibany</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Syrian rescuers evacuate a person injured following airstrikes<media:description type="plain">Rescuers assist a victim following airstrikes on the besieged rebel-held enclave of Kafr Batna, Syria,  on Feb. 6.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328521/180214-syria-ghouta-hospital-njs-1010a_21916582a763aef0d5781a6a6d96204f.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mohammed Badra</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Patients await treatment<media:description type="plain">Patients await treatment at a hospital in Eastern Ghouta, Syria.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-blasts-fbi-over-parkland-shooting-says-too-much-time-n849121?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trump blasts FBI over shooting, says 'too much time' on Russia</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 16:24:59 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-blasts-fbi-over-parkland-shooting-says-too-much-time-n849121?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Phil Helsel</dc:creator>
      <description>Trump tweeted the FBI missed signals before a school shooting, and "are spending too much time trying to prove Russian collusion with the Trump campaign."</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">nn_kti_lowell_bailey_olympics_180217</guid>
      <title>Biathlete Lowell Bailey chases Olympic history</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:01:11 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/biathlete-lowell-bailey-chases-olympic-history-1164172867990</link>
      <dc:creator></dc:creator>
      <description>Lowell Bailey was the first American to win World Championship gold in biathlon—a grueling sport that combines cross-country skiing and target shooting. The 36-year-old hopes to help earn the United States' first Olympic medal in the sport.</description>
      <media:content url="" medium="video">
        <media:title>Biathlete Lowell Bailey chases Olympic history</media:title>
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:player url="https://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/biathlete-lowell-bailey-chases-olympic-history-1164172867990" />
        <media:description type="plain">Lowell Bailey was the first American to win World Championship gold in biathlon—a grueling sport that combines cross-country skiing and target shooting. The 36-year-old hopes to help earn the United States' first Olympic medal in the sport.</media:description>
        <media:thumbnail url="https://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/MSNBC/Components/Video/201802/nn_kti_lowell_bailey_olympics_180217_1920x1080.jpg" />
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/kehinde-wiley-s-obama-portrait-controversy-shows-americans-don-t-ncna849156?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Obama's portrait controversy shows Americans don't know how to engage with art</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 12:53:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/kehinde-wiley-s-obama-portrait-controversy-shows-americans-don-t-ncna849156?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Seph Rodney </dc:creator>
      <description>Audiences think contemporary paintings should be easily understandable for anyone with eyes. But this is not the case.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331726/180216-obama-portrait-ew-253p_803b11e5557a0a59460dcca92dadca00.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Andrew Harnik</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Barack Obama, Kehinde Wiley<media:description type="plain">Look but don't touch.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331721/180216-obama-portrait-ew-252p_803b11e5557a0a59460dcca92dadca00.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Shawn Thew</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Portraits of former US President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama at the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery<media:description type="plain">Former President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama stand with their official portraits and the artists who created them during the unveiling ceremony at the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/charges-mueller-could-have-brought-against-russians-didn-t-n849006?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>The charges Mueller could have brought but didn't</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 15:54:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/charges-mueller-could-have-brought-against-russians-didn-t-n849006?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Danny Cevallos</dc:creator>
      <description>Why would special counsel Robert Mueller allege illegal Russian activity in the election throughout the indictment, but not actually charge it?</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332126/180216-rod-rosenstein-ac-736p_6ed13561877921a48fb9039a2ccfdfe9.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jacquelyn Martin</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Rod Rosenstein<media:description type="plain">Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein announces on Feb. 16, 2018, that special counsel Robert Mueller has indicted 13 Russian nationals and several Russian entities with meddling in the 2016 presidential election.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/gop-sen-lankford-open-stronger-gun-background-checks-n849176?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Sen. Lankford has 'no issue' with stronger gun background checks</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 15:39:41 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/gop-sen-lankford-open-stronger-gun-background-checks-n849176?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Kailani Koenig</dc:creator>
      <description>Republican Sen. James Lankford said Sunday he is open to stronger background checks for gun sales.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2333096/lankford_9f95c0b3a90157e7480f09939d73b837.png" medium="image" height="365" width="647">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/social-media/screams-gunshots-social-media-changed-what-public-sees-hears-during-n848441?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Screams and gunshots: Social media changed how the public sees and hears school shootings</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 21:09:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/social-media/screams-gunshots-social-media-changed-what-public-sees-hears-during-n848441?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Dartunorro Clark and Jason Abbruzzese</dc:creator>
      <description>Scenes from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, were viewed by millions of people almost live on Wednesday.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330336/180215-stoneman-douglas-shooting-video-149p-rs_70beab794e2829d63e911ac6b3ce283b.JPG" medium="image" height="2500" width="2221">
        <media:credit>Wilfredo Lee</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A student shows a law enforcement officer a photo or video from his phone, on Feb. 14, 2018, in Parkland, Florida.<media:description type="plain">A student shows a law enforcement officer a photo or video from his phone, on Feb. 14, 2018, in Parkland, Florida.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/airplane-mode/iran-plane-crash-passenger-aircraft-carrying-66-people-goes-down-n849136?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Plane crashes in southern Iran, killing all 66 on board</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 13:06:08 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/airplane-mode/iran-plane-crash-passenger-aircraft-carrying-66-people-goes-down-n849136?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ali Arouzi and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The ATR-72, a twin-engine turboprop used for short-distance regional flying, went down some 390 miles south of the capital, Tehran.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332981/semiron_040c6bec684dd293c968ba2d6e3a6838.jpg" medium="image" height="640" width="1047">
        <media:credit>Google Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Location of Semirom<media:description type="plain">Location of Semirom, Iran.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.nbcolympics.com/video/curling-meets-mario?cid=eref:nbcnews:video</guid>
      <title>Curling meets Super Mario: You've never seen the sport like this</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:47:51 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>http://www.nbcolympics.com/video/curling-meets-mario?cid=eref:nbcnews:video</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>We bet you've never seen curling like this before.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332991/gettyimages-915733904-e1518593291487_458446c2d936e89bec5a883a2a255d6f.jpg" medium="image" height="343" width="610">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-strikes-gaza-after-bomb-wounds-soldiers-two-palestinians-dead-n849146?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Two teens killed after Israel bombs Gaza</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 12:23:32 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-strikes-gaza-after-bomb-wounds-soldiers-two-palestinians-dead-n849146?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Paul Goldman and Lawahez Jabari and Alice Tidey and Associated Press and Reuters</dc:creator>
      <description>Israel launched attacks on 18 targets belonging to the Hamas militant group after four soldiers were wounded Saturday when a bomb detonated on the border with Gaza.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332996/gaza_4c3be4d5e2878d5257ffb99251fad67b.jpg" medium="image" height="598" width="1091">
        <media:credit>Google Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Map shows location of the Gaza Strip<media:description type="plain">Map shows location of the Gaza Strip.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/after-parkland-school-shooting-hundreds-attend-nearby-gun-show-miami-n849066?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>After Parkland shooting, hundreds attend nearby gun show</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 20:35:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/after-parkland-school-shooting-hundreds-attend-nearby-gun-show-miami-n849066?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Matthew Vann</dc:creator>
      <description>"There's no disrespect or insensitivity intended by this long-planned gun show," a statement from organizers said.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332656/180217-florida-gun-show-2-309p-rs_8d73e29392f4a4c6f4e37999c494e6fe.jpg" medium="image" height="1614" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Andrew Innerarity</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: With a variant of the AR-15 in the foreground, patrons peruse weapons at a gun show in Miami, Florida on Feb. 17, 2018.<media:description type="plain">With a variant of the AR-15 in the foreground, patrons peruse weapons at a gun show in Miami, Florida, on Feb. 17, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332661/180217-florida-gun-show-3-309p-rs_8d73e29392f4a4c6f4e37999c494e6fe.jpg" medium="image" height="1875" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Andrew Innerarity</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Patrons peruse weapons at a gun show in Miami, Florida, Feb. 17, 2018.<media:description type="plain">Patrons peruse weapons at a gun show in Miami, Florida, Feb. 17, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/legendary-climber-jim-bridwell-dies-73-n849111?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Legendary climber Jim Bridwell dies at 73</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 03:08:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/legendary-climber-jim-bridwell-dies-73-n849111?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>Jim Bridwell, a hard-partying hippie and legendary climber who lived his life vertically on some of the toughest peaks in Yosemite National Park, has died.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332936/ap_18049062579145_0232c90b781dae2d1ee093f5b4431a38.jpg" medium="image" height="2250" width="3000">
        <media:credit>Ron Gomez via AP</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Jim Bridwell, Ron Gomez, Ron Kauk<media:description type="plain">This 2015 photo provided by Ron Gomez shows climbers Ron Kauk, from left, Jim Bridwell, and Ron Gomez in Tuolumne Meadows in Yosemite National Park, Calif.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332941/ap_18049062535557_7d89cfd5bad3536c5bc99cdac1293334.jpg" medium="image" height="2250" width="3000">
        <media:credit>Ron Gomez</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Layton Kor, Jim Bridwell<media:description type="plain">This Jan. 18, 2013 photo provided by Ron Gomez shows legendary climbers Layton Kor, left, and Jim Bridwell in Kingman, Ariz.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/black-panther-s-glorious-depiction-wakanda-envisions-africa-black-dreams-ncna849016?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Joy Reid: 'Black Panther' envisions what could have been for black Americans</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 15:14:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/black-panther-s-glorious-depiction-wakanda-envisions-africa-black-dreams-ncna849016?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Joy-Ann Reid</dc:creator>
      <description>The movie leaves us with powerful, complicated questions: What might the strongest of us built had we remained in Africa?</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2327401/180213-black-panther-movie-janeshia-adams-ginyard-se-1359p_c283f16d2a7e8f43908f1b3b7f9fc441.jpg" medium="image" height="1080" width="2048">
        <media:credit>Elton Anderson</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Danai Gurira as Okoye, left, and Florence Kasumba as Ayo with the Dora Milaje in "Black Panther"<media:description type="plain">What's truly revolutionary about the film is its expansive, breathtaking vision</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/florida-school-shooting-these-are-17-victims-n848706?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>The 17 victims of the Parkland school shooting</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:59:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/florida-school-shooting-these-are-17-victims-n848706?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Jonathan Sperling</dc:creator>
      <description>The Parkland school shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School claimed 17 victims on Wednesday.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332641/180217-parkland-victims-16up-composite_328c53ab607603603756bcd450b817ed.jpg" medium="image" height="800" width="1200">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: 16 of the 17 fatal victims of the Parkland school shooting.<media:description type="plain">16 of the 17 fatal victims of the Parkland school shooting.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331921/180216-alyssa-alhadeff-parkland-victim-mn-1715_89710fc0e687bf1eb2e83cd34ac8d5fa.jpg" medium="image" height="683" width="1065">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Alyssa Alhadeff<media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331906/180216-parkland-victim-scott_beigel-mn-1640_de9fff7cb8e7f931520543762259ed55.jpg" medium="image" height="734" width="1044">
        <media:credit>Family photo</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Scott Beigel<media:description type="plain">Scott Beigel</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Punk rockers pay the price for criticizing Putin</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:07:45 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Alexander Smith and Vladimir Banic and Alan Kaytukov</dc:creator>
      <description>With Vladimir Putin expected to secure a fourth term next month, Pussy Riot members Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan are claiming asylum in Sweden.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328081/180212-pussy-riot-exile102_be44ba3028d5fb766378a28fd19801f4.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot activists Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have fled Russia for Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328406/180214-pussy-riot-mc-1408_10a3946a68355257c728586eb2632b1c.JPG" medium="image" height="2892" width="4206">
        <media:credit>Sergey Ponomarev</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot<media:description type="plain">Members of Pussy Riot chant a "punk prayer" that criticized Vladimir Putin at the Christ the Saviour Cathedral in Moscow, Russia, in 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328091/180212-pussy-riot-exile104_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">The apartment block where Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan live in Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328111/180212-pussy-riot-exile108_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1949" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky looks in his bathroom mirror.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328456/180214-pussy-riot-0950_66cc55b7cfd888845a651df9d1d17184.jpg" medium="image" height="2436" width="3496">
        <media:credit>ANDREY SMIRNOV</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Yekaterina Samutsevich, Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot members Yekaterina Samutsevich (left), Maria Alyokhina (center) and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova (right) during a court hearing in Moscow on Aug. 17, 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328116/180212-pussy-riot-exile109_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1896" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan with their son, Tigran.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328106/180212-pussy-riot-exile107_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have been in Sweden for almost a year.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/tips</guid>
      <title>Got a news tip? We want to know about it</title>

      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/tips</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>Do you have a story to share with us? Did you witness something you think should be reported? Reach out to our journalists by sending in your news tip.</description>

        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
